ray.rage.scene

Interface Node

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Nameable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    SceneNode
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericSceneNode

    public interface Node
extends Nameable
    A node is a general-purpose object used to represent an articulated graph.

    A node contains information about the transformations that are applicable to itself and all of its children. Child nodes combine their local-space transforms with their parent's to derive their own world-space transforms.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Node.Controller
      A controller handles nodes make it easier to apply behaviors by concrete implementations.
      static interface  Node.Listener
      A listener for Node events.

      • notifyAttached

        void notifyAttached(Node newParent)
        Tells this node that it has been attached to the specified parent. If this node has a Node.Listener and its new parent is different to the current one, then it emits Node.Listener#onNodeAttached(Node). If both the new and current parents are the same, then no "re-parenting" has really taken place and the listener does nothing.

        The root node does not have a parent. Adding a parent to the root node wouldn't make sense and could cause infinite cycles through the graph.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Parameters:
        newParent - The new parent for this node.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the new parent is null.
        See Also:
        attachChild(Node), notifyDetached()

      • notifyDetached

        void notifyDetached()
        Tells this node that it has been detached from its current parent. If this node has a Node.Listener and a non-null parent, then it emits Node.Listener#onNodeDetached(Node). If this node was already detached, then the listener does nothing.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        See Also:
        detachChild(Node), notifyAttached(Node)

      • getParent

        Node getParent()
        Gets this node's parent node, if any. Otherwise null.

        The root node always returns null.

        Returns:
        The parent node of this node, if any.

      • attachChild

        void attachChild(Node child)
        Adds a node as a child of this node. The child is automatically notified via notifyAttached(Node).

        A child can have only one parent. If it's already attached to another node, it must be detached first.

        Parameters:
        child - The node to be a child of this one.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the child is already attached or is null.
        See Also:
        detachChild(Node), notifyAttached(Node)

      • getChild

        Node getChild(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a direct descendant of this node.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the descendant.
        Returns:
        A descendant of this node.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a descendant with the given name is not found.
        See Also:
        getChild(int), attachChild(Node)

      • getChild

        Node getChild(int index)
        Gets a direct descendant of this node, based on the order in which they were attached.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the child node.
        Returns:
        A direct child of this node at the specified index.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If a index < 0 || index >= getChildCount().
        See Also:
        getChild(String), attachChild(Node)

      • getChildCount

        int getChildCount()
        Gets the number of direct descendants this node has.
        Returns:
        The current number of child nodes.

        Gets an Iterable to go over the direct descendants of this node.
        Returns:

      • detachChild

        void detachChild(Node child)
        Detaches the specified node from this node. The child is automatically notified via notifyDetached().
        Parameters:
        child - The node to be detached.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the node is not a direct child of this node or is null.
        See Also:
        detachChild(Node), notifyAttached(Node)

      • detachAllChildren

        void detachAllChildren()

      • update

        void update(boolean updateChildren,
            boolean parentHasChanged)
        Updates the node and (optionally) causes the updates to propagate through the graph.
        Parameters:
        updateChildren - If true, the update cascades down to all children. False otherwise. Specific SceneManager implementations may want to update nodes manually.
        parentHasChanged - This flag indicates that the parent transform has changed and that the child should retrieve the parent's transform to combine it with its own, even if it hasn't changed itself.

      • update

        void update()
        Updates the node and automatically causes updates to propagate through the graph. This node will let its children know if it has changed in some way, so that the children can know whether they need to update themselves. 
         boolean changed = parentHasChanged || thisHasChanged;
 node.update(true, changed);
        See Also:
        update(boolean, boolean)

      • updateFromParent

        void updateFromParent()
        Update this node's transforms using its parent's derived transforms.

      • setListener

        void setListener(Node.Listener listener)
        Sets the current listener for this node.
        Parameters:
        listener - The Node.Listener of this node.

      • getListener

        Node.Listener getListener()
        Gets the current Node.Listener of this node, if any.
        Returns:
        The current Node.Listener, if any, or null.
